meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Alright, folks! It's your boy here, back with another review that's all about the game play and none of the fancy-schmancy critic stuff. So grab a bag of popcorn, sit back, and let me tell you what I think about Tales of Kenzera: Zau!

Now, I know what you're thinking - "What makes this review so special?" Well, let me tell you, my friends. As someone who's all about having fun, I'm not here to give you a bunch of fancy analysis or compare it to other games. No, sir! I'm here to give you the lowdown on whether Tales of Kenzera: Zau is worth your time and hard-earned cash.

First off, let me just say that this game is all about the journey, not the destination. It's got a lot of heart, man - literally! The story is about a dude named Zuberi who loses his loved ones and has to find a way to move on. And let me tell you, it's some deep stuff. Like, I'm talking "Inception" levels of emotional depth here!

But enough about the feels, right? What about the game play? Well, here's the thing: it's solid. The platforming is tight, the combat is satisfying, and those powers early on are a godsend for any new player. But, you know what they say - absolute precision is required! And let me tell you, my friends, it can get frustrating at times.

Now, I know some of you critics out there might be thinking, "Hey, what about the level design?" Well, let's just say that it's...fine. I mean, it's not gonna win any awards or anything, but it gets the job done. And hey, who needs innovative level design when you've got a story that'll make you cry?

So, in conclusion - Tales of Kenzera: Zau is all about the journey, not the destination. It's got some deep themes, solid game play, and a whole lot of heart. But hey, if you're looking for something to rival your favorite Metroidvania games, this might not be it.

Thanks for reading, folks! Don't forget to leave your thoughts in the comments below!
